attributes.action: to be compelled by law to positively act when an E-Petition is supported by more than 500,000 signatures
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Currently the Prime Minister has blatantly ignored a string of highly supported E-Petitions. If we're truly democratic, it should not be possible for the Prime Minister to simply dismiss the views and wishes of the population. Prime examples of which would be the Road Pricing, and ID card E-Petitions both of which were simply ignored.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
